contentrichtext.text: '''Qasim Shah''' (or Kasim Shah), son of [[Amanullah (Sufi poet)|Amanullah]], was born in 1731 AD,<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=YCJrUfVtZxoC&pg=PA127&lpg=PA127&dq=Hans+Jawahir&source=bl&ots=Ktpvq2IIQB&sig=eqnMh2L4Cjf6DJBx44qc8V63Y7E&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=2&ct=result A Dictionary of Indian Literature By Sujit Mukherjee]</ref> he carried forward the literary tradition of [[Sufi]]-atic poetry. He has given a very interesting account in Hans-Jawahir(1736),<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=KnPoYxrRfc0C&pg=PA4206&lpg=PA4206&dq=%22Qasim+Shah%22+1731&source=bl&ots=Y5JzF3oBuY&sig=HPOfTV8Qp3mVY5WRyPDwS0jozIM&hl=en&sa=X&oi=book_result&resnum=4&ct=result Encyclpopaedia of Indian Literature]</ref> the love story of Hans, the son of Sultan Budhaan Shah of [[Balkh]]-[[Bukhara]] and Jawahir the daughter of Alamshah of [[China]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Qasim, Shah | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Indian writer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1731 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Qasim, Shah}} [[Category:1731 births]] [[Category:Urdu-language fiction writers]] [[Category:Indian people]] [[Category:People from Barabanki]] [[Category:Year of death unknown]] {{India-writer-stub}}
